author: Staff Reporter
text:
Girls gear up to write the Plus Two examinations at Thiruvalluvar Government Girls Higher Secondary School in Puducherry on Friday.— Photo: S.S. Kumar

Over 15,000 students in Puducherry and Karaikal regions appeared for the Plus Two examinations which began on Friday.

In Puducherry, a total of 12,080 students, including 6,513 girls and 5,567 boys wrote the Language I paper in 27 centres.

In Karaikal

As many as 2,257 candidates including 260 private candidates appeared for the exam in eight centres in the Karaikal region.

The district administration had made elaborate arrangements in all centres. A total of three flying squads visited a number of centres to prevent students from indulging in malpractices.

As many as 681 invigilators were in charge to ensure the smooth progress of the exam. An official said that invigilators were also given the task of matching the photograph in the name list and hall ticket to prevent impersonation.

No malpractice was reported on the first day in any of the centres in Puducherry and Karaikal.
title: Over 15,000 students write Plus Two exams
